title: GNIP subdomain take over
content:
Hello,
Your subdomain at blog.gnipcentral.com is not well configured with allows subdomain take over as @fransoren explained in report #145224 .
PoC:
<image_0>
Please for more information visit the report made by @fransorosen, it's explained with all details possible.
Thanks,
Hussein

screenshots.image_0: Go to http://blog.gnipcentral.com/ , you will be redirected to my domain http://testcloudfrontbug.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/asd/index.html

steps: Verify that the subdomain is not properly configured, allowing for a subdomain takeover.
vuln_description: The subdomain blog.gnipcentral.com is not properly configured, which allows for a subdomain takeover. This means an attacker can claim control of the subdomain and potentially host malicious content or perform phishing attacks.
reason: The vulnerability involves identifying a misconfigured subdomain, which is a straightforward process and does not require complex interactions or multiple components. The issue is well-documented and commonly understood in the security community.
